adjectives.description: companionate (comparative more companionate, superlative most companionate)

entries.meaning: (now historical) Designating a proposed type of marriage (or other partnership) in which the partners plan to have no children and take on no legal obligations to one another. [from 20th c.]
Pertaining to a (chiefly romantic) relationship that emphasises companionship and mutual respect. [from 20th c.]
examples: Gradually it evolved from an economic enterprise to a companionate one—a free-choice engagement between two individuals, based not on duty and obligation but on love and affection.
